Detailed Description

A quaternion rotation class.

This is an overloaded member function, provided for convenience. It differs from the above function only in what argument(s) it accepts. Initialize with a rotation around an axis of the given angle.

const DzVec3 &  angles

This is an overloaded member function, provided for convenience. It differs from the above function only in what argument(s) it accepts. Initialize with an Euler angle rotation.

void DzQuat::makeClosest ( const DzQuat &  r  ) 

Makes sure that this rotation lies on the same side of the hypershpere as the one given. If not, it is altered to do so.

void DzQuat::makeCloseToZero ( DzRotationOrder  order,
DzVec3 &  rotVec2 
) [static]

Changes the rotation vector in place to have angles that are each as close to zero as possible. Angle values should be in DEGREES.

void DzQuat::makeIdentity (  ) 

Zero this rotation

void DzQuat::multPnt ( DzPnt3 &  src  )  const

Puts the given direction vector through this rotation. Vector is forced to unit length. Return value is also a unit vector. (Multiplies the given vector by the matrix of this rotation),.

DzVec3 DzQuat::multVec ( const DzVec3 &  src  )  const

Puts the given direction vector through this rotation. Vector is forced to unit length. Return value is also a unit vector. Multiplies the given vector by the matrix of this rotation),.

void DzQuat::removeGimbal ( DzRotationOrder  order,
const DzVec3 &  rotVec1,
DzVec3 &  rotVec2 
) [static]

Compares the two Euler angle rotations of the given order to see if a gimbal happens between them. If it does, it is removed by changing rotVec2 in place. Angle values should be in DEGREES.

void DzQuat::scaleAngle ( float  scaleFactor  ) 

Keep the axis the same. Multiply the angle of rotation by the amount 'scaleFactor'

void DzQuat::setValue ( const DzVec3 &  xAxis,
const DzVec3 &  yAxis 
)

Sets the value based on the X and Y axes of the rotation. The x axis is taken to be true and the y axis is adjusted to be normal to x.

DzQuat DzQuat::slerp ( const DzQuat &  r1,
const DzQuat &  r2,
float  t 
) [static]

Spherical linear interpolation: as t goes from 0 to 1, returned value goes from rot0 to rot1
